elements.content: Front end is functionality on the side of the client (HTML/CSS/JS). HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language. It is used to design the layout of text and structure of a webpage.
This is my page

Headings define the header of a section or page. For example, [[monospace]]

[[/]] creates a large heading. Paragraphs add bodies of text, and are created with the [[monospace]]

[[/]] tag. Image dags display images on webpages from URLs or local files. Hyperlinks are clickable lines of text to add in a website to redirect the user to another page or website

CSS makes websites look nice by changing style, location, and more of elements. CSS stands for "Cascading Style Sheets". CSS does not add any new content to the page.
Some common CSS styles include:
  - font-family: Change the font of an element.
  - font-size: Change the size of an element.
  - text-align: Center, left or right align text.
  - color: Change the color of text.
  - text-decoration: Add underlines, strikethroughs and other decorations.
  - Draw borders around elements.
Selector events activate CSS on an event, such as a hover.
Animation transitions apply smoother transitions to elements

Purpose of JavaScript:
  - Full stack development (client-side execution + server-side scripting)
  - Creating animations, graphics, pop-ups, interactive material, etc.
Console:
  - A message/output window display for developers
  - Can be used for debugging and shows error/security/network messages
Variables and constants:

let temperature; // scoped
var day; // global
const x = 0 // constant

JS is loosely typed/dynamic - variables be assigned to any type. The primitive types are string, number, bigint, boolean, undefined, symbol, and null.
JavaScript properties are data contained by the instance of an object or type. They can be accessed using the dot operator (.) and the property name.
JavaScript conditionals execute code blocks if specified conditions are met. If, else, else if, and switch statements are all conditionals.

Functions define reusable blocks of code. Instead of repeating code for the same actions, functions are used for the same results.
The DOM provides functionality for editing, retrieving, and detecting events in the HTML document.

Link stylesheets using [[monospace]]<link rel=”stylesheet” href=”style.css”>[[/]] in the head section of the HTML file.
  - [[monospace]]rel[[/]] attribute is required: specifies the relationship between the linked document and the current document
  - [[monospace]]href[[/]] attribute contains the url of the linked document
[[monospace]]type[[/]] attribute specifies the media type of the linked document
Multiple stylesheets can be linked, but many websites use a single sheet to avoid rewriting code and for faster load time (choose what is best for your project)
JavaScript functionality can be added with the script tag (either external or embedded)
If you plan to use libraries such as JQuery, Bootstrap, etc., you can add their JS files from a CDN before your other scripts in the HTML file.
